EmailTemplate.description: Western Union Licence Registration - S75 Completion
EmailTemplate.name: Western Union Licence Registration - S75 Completion
EmailTemplate.subject: {!Membership__c.Name} Western Union Licence Registration - S75 Completion
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Organisation Name: {!Membership__c.Account__c} {!Membership__c.Name}
Dear Licensee,
Please be advised that AUSTRAC have requested the attached Section 75 Notice be completed and returned to support your application to be registered as a remittance services provider on the Remittance Service Register (RSR). This change is requested under subsection 75N(1) of the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorism Financing Act 2006.
AUSTRAC require you to:
Complete the online training that your RNP has enrolled you in called: AML/CTF for Compliance Officers Complete Questions 1 - 35 in your own words (AUSTRAC will not approve copy/paste, scripted or paraphrased responses)
Please Note: Australia Post will lodge your National Police Check Certificates directly to AUSTRAC
Your Checklist: Ensure the following information is returned to the Workforce Due Diligence Team Complete:
Answer all questions and demonstrate an understanding of AML/CTF obligations and practical application of these obligations in your LPO Provide your Signature using the electronic signature instruction Email the complete S75N Questionnaire and all documents to aml.dataentry@auspost.com.au
If you require more information, please contact Workforce Due Diligence at aml.dataentry@auspost.com.au or 03 9322 0621
Kind Regards
Workforce Due Diligence Team
Australia Post will never send you an email asking for your password, credit card details or account information.
This email was sent by Australia Post, 111 Bourke Street, MELBOURNE VIC 3000. If you have any concerns, or don't think you should have received this email, please email aml.dataentry@auspost.com.au. Visit ourpost.com.au for further information on our online security.
